radiographic_examinations.findings: An expansile, nonenhancing lesion in the anterior left frontal lobe with T2-weighted hyperintensity, without abnormal enhancement or restricted diffusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Evidence of little or no progression consistent with an indolent lesion such as a low-grade primary CNS neoplasm. Gradual development of abnormal, nonenhancing, mildly expansile tissue along the posterior margin of the resection cavity and infiltrating adjacent brain parenchyma was noted over time.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A corresponding hypodense lesion in the same region of the anterior left frontal lobe.
Residual T2-weighted hyperintensity along the margin of the resection cavity.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Stable appearance and extent of signal abnormality in adjacent structures after second resection, followed by a decrease in the degree of infiltration and extent of the abnormal tissue after chemotherapy.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Decreased abnormal tissue along the posterior margin of the resection cavity and in the left insula and anterior left temporal lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive decrease in abnormal tissue post-chemotherapy.
